Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Omio’s vision is to enable people to travel seamlessly anywhere, anyway. We are bringing all global transport into a single distribution system and creating end-to-end magical consumer journeys.

With Omio you can compare and book trains, buses, ferries and flights anywhere in Europe, the US, and Canada with one simple search, on mobile, app or desktop. By offering transparent pricing and easy booking, Omio makes travel planning simple, flexible and personal.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, with 1000+ suppliers operating in 39 countries. Our brands also include Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, which attract 900m+ users every year. Our offices are based in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London.

We are a growing team of more than 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who share the same vision: to create a single tool to help send travellers almost anywhere in the world.

Job Description

The Commercial Analytics team’s primary responsibility is in the integration, measurement and optimisation of our travel inventory. Working with hundreds of travel providers across many thousands of routes, the team ensures we have the options our customers need.

The team collaborates closely across the business, particularly with our commercial, product, and finance functions, and has a significant impact on setting and delivering on our strategic priorities relating to expanding our global inventory. The team also has responsibilities in supporting our B2B business and working with finance on Payments and Fraud operations, but this role is very focused on global inventory.

Main Tasks & Responsibilities


Understand Omio’s business model, particularly around the supply of travel inventory across the globe.
Understand and lead on establishing Omio’s top-line metrics and KPIs, reporting their evolution, detecting anomalies, evaluating key drivers, and diagnosing issue root causes.
Build dashboards to support efficient dissemination of the above trends
Work alongside the commercial team to draw insights on the performance of key commercial metrics related to inventory, funnel conversions, bookings, basket size, take rates, etc. across markets
Build forecasting models to understand gaps in current performance and sales/revenue optimization models to enhance margins without negatively impacting user experience
Perform statistical analyses - including A/B tests and pre/post analyses
Correlate marketing/product/commercial data to derive key insights
Work with our data engineering/business intelligence teams to build data models, which best summarise and utilise our production data
Spot, highlight, and initiate actions on emerging and existing risks related to liabilities and open positions with customers (for example, cancellation liabilities, commission risk, etc.)
Act as an advocate of our company’s data-driven culture: produce reports that are actionable, dashboards that are diagnostic, and recommendations that drive growth


Qualifications

Qualifications:


University degree in Business, Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a similar field; 3+ years of relevant work experience, preferably in e-commerce, consultancy or banking/finance.
Passionate about working with numbers; excellent analytical skills, confidence in working with large data sets and expert in SQL and Excel/Google sheets (R/Python is a plus)
Fluent in English; additional languages are always valued at Omio


Additional Information

What’s in it for you?


Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride
A competitive and attractive compensation package
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
A diverse team of more than 45 nationalities


Diversity makes us stronger

We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all the relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

Recruitment scams: Important notice

Protect yourself from scammers, Omio wants to ensure your ongoing safety during the application process at Omio. Please keep in mind potential scammers impersonating Omio recruiters (mainly via a global professional networking site, and messenger app's).

Remember, Omio never requests payment or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to recruitment@omio.com. Remember to cross-reference against our careers page if you question the authenticity, stay vigilant, and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Title: Alternant Data Analyst
Description:
Kaischool recherche un Alternant Data Analyste (F/H) pour rejoindre l’un de ses partenaires spécialisés dans l’analyse et la science des données. Si vous êtes passionné par les données et souhaitez acquérir une expérience pratique dans un environnement stimulant, ce poste est fait pour vous !

Votre Rôle

En tant qu'alternant Data Analyste, vous intégrerez notre équipe dynamique de professionnels de la donnée. Vous bénéficierez de l'accompagnement de nos experts en analyse de données et contribuerez activement à des projets variés. Votre mission inclura :


Analyse des besoins en données : Identifier les besoins analytiques de l’entreprise et définir les objectifs d’analyse pour générer des insights pertinents.
Collecte et gestion des données : Extraire des données de sources diverses telles que bases de données, fichiers Excel, et API.
Préparation des données : Nettoyer et préparer les données pour une analyse efficace.
Analyse approfondie : Utiliser des outils comme Python, R, SQL ou Excel pour réaliser des analyses détaillées.
Création de visualisations : Développer des tableaux de bord et des graphiques pour présenter les données de manière claire et visuelle.
Rédaction de rapports : Élaborer des rapports et proposer des recommandations basées sur les analyses effectuées.
Collaboration interdisciplinaire : Travailler avec des Data Scientists et des Data Engineers pour résoudre des problématiques complexes.


Votre Profil


Formation : Vous êtes en Bac+3 ou Bac+4 en mathématiques, statistiques, informatique ou un domaine similaire.
Compétences techniques : Vous maîtrisez les outils d’analyse de données tels qu'Excel, SQL, Python ou R.
Analyse de données : Vous avez l’habitude de manipuler et d’analyser de grandes quantités de données.
Connaissance statistique : Vous êtes familiarisé avec les techniques statistiques et les méthodes d’analyse.
Visualisation : Vous comprenez les principes de visualisation de données et avez de l’expérience dans la création de tableaux de bord.
Communication : Vous êtes capable de présenter les résultats de manière claire et concise.
Esprit d'équipe : Vous aimez collaborer avec d’autres professionnels pour atteindre des objectifs communs.


Détails De L’emploi


Type de contrat : Alternance
Horaires : Du lundi au vendredi, en journée
Lieu : Poste en présentiel


Formation Requise


Bac +3 (Licence / Bachelor) (Optionnel)


Envoyez-nous dès maintenant votre candidature et faites le premier pas vers une carrière réussie dans l'analyse de données !

Nous avons hâte de découvrir votre talent et de vous accueillir dans notre équipe !

Type d'emploi : Alternance

Rémunération: 25042,70€ à 47957,97€ par an

Lieu du poste : En présentiel

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Company: IRCA Group is a leading international B2B provider of semi-finished ingredients for the bakery, pastry, and gelato markets. Our products cater to independent producers as well as large food manufacturers. We produce chocolate, decorations, creams, inclusions, pastry mixes, gelato ingredients, and other bakery/pastry essentials. Headquartered in Italy, IRCA Group boasts a strong track record of growth over the past decade, with 22 manufacturing facilities all over the world, 2000+ employee and €1 billion of revenues.

What we offer: IRCA fosters a dynamic environment, embracing diversity and valuing diverse perspectives and international experiences, offering a stimulating context. We promote professional growth by providing tailor-made development programs and career advancement opportunities locally and internationally. With locations worldwide, we offer the chance to work on international projects, collaborate across cultures, and gain a global perspective. Joining our team means becoming part of a global community of passionate professionals dedicated to making a difference. If you are looking for stimulating challenges and the chance to contribute your ideas for process improvement in an ever-growing company, IRCA is the right place.

Purpose of Position: We are currently looking for a talented and motivated Data Analyst Intern to join our Demand Planning team in the Supply Chain department.

Description Of Main Activities/Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyze data related to sales forecasts, inventory, and supply chain processes.
Assist in the development and maintenance of demand forecasting models.
Identify trends and patterns in data to help optimize inventory management and improve forecasting accuracy.
Support the team in creating dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Sales, Supply Chain, Marketing) to provide data-driven insights for decision making.
Assist in ad-hoc data analysis projects as needed.


Requirements


Education:Data Science/Analyst, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or a related field.
Professional Skills:Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Language Skills:Proficiency in Italian and English is mandatory
Computer Skills:Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel (pivot tables, etc.) and/or statistical tools like Python, R, or SQL.
Behavioural Requirements: Excellent communication and relational and problem-solving skills. Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.


We welcome applications from candidates of all genders, backgrounds, identities, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief. Join us in creating a workplace where diversity is valued, and everyone can thrive.

Title: Consulting & Analytics Graduate
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive.

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) teams are focused in helping key clients that include global banks and retailers and other merchants, as well as local FinTech’s and governments. Our goal is to help clients solve strategic payment challenges and identify opportunities by supporting in benchmarking, ideation, definition, implementation and monitoring of recommendations. Resulting in our clients receiving end-to-end support that help them achieve scale, competitive advantage, and speed to market in the digital age.

Exemplary projects:


How can a retail bank drive activation and usage of payment solutions (e.g., cards) in specific customer segments?
How can an airline build and enhance its payment value proposition for consumers and/or small businesses?
How can a credit card issuer use emerging technologies like open banking to acquire new customers?
How can an acquirer or merchant better understand customer loyalty?


VCA engages clients throughout Europe and is organised in teams within, UK & Ireland, South Europe, FBL, Nordics & Baltics, Central Eastern Europe, and Central Europe

Day to day responsibilities of a Graduate Consultant:


Help drive business insights with data gathering and market trend analysis thanks to our superb data analytics powered by Visa data.
Support the VCA team in the delivery of projects for Visa clients across various domains, from payments, digital, products to strategy, including project management.
Co-lead strategy to market activities including but not limited to workshops, client meetings, content development etc.
Develop, with assistance from your manager, VCA project deliverables (based in PowerPoint, excel, etc.) for assigned clients.


Visa’s Graduate Programme:

Visa hires into its Graduate programme across Asia Pacific (APAC), Latin America (LAC), CEMEA (Central Europe, Middle East & Africa) and Europe. Within each region we hire Graduates into a variety of business functions, joining as one cohort, part of a Global programme.

This is a 2-year programme, where you are supported with various skills and development sessions throughout your time as a Graduate.

By joining VCA as a Graduate you will:

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¡En @Ayesa crecemos juntos! 🚀 ✨




Cada profesional de nuestra empresa es importante para nosotros, nos ayudan a crecer de manera diversa y gracias a ellos somos más de 13.000 personas trabajando con el mismo objetivo en más de 40 países.

Si eres una persona entusiasta, te apasiona la #tecnología y buscas un nuevo reto profesional ¡Este es tu sitio!

Estamos buscando un/a Analista de Datos que colabore estrechamente con el equipo de administración para desarrollar herramientas avanzadas de análisis que optimicen la infraestructura tecnológica y mejoren los procesos de decisión.




¡Anímate a dar el salto!¡Te estamos esperando!




Funciones:




Colaborar directamente con el equipo directivo para analizar y monitorizar el rendimiento de la infraestructura tecnológica.
Desarrollar informes y dashboards que proporcionen visibilidad en tiempo real sobre el estado de la infraestructura (almacenamiento, servidores, redes) y la calidad del servicio.
Realizar análisis predictivo para prever necesidades futuras de recursos tecnológicos (almacenamiento, capacidad de servidores, redes, etc.).
Desarrollar modelos de optimización de uso de recursos que ayuden en la planificación y distribución eficiente de la capacidad tecnológica.
Automatizar procesos de recolección y procesamiento de datos relacionados con la infraestructura tecnológica y la gestión del servicio.
Proponer mejoras y soluciones basadas en los datos para garantizar la estabilidad, rendimiento y crecimiento sostenido de la infraestructura.
Apoyar en la toma de decisiones estratégicas sobre la ampliación de la infraestructura y la implementación de nuevas tecnologías.




Conocimientos Técnicos y Tecnologías:




Título en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Estadística o afines.
Experiencia en análisis de datos relacionados con infraestructuras tecnológicas (almacenamiento, servidores, redes).
Habilidades avanzadas en Python y/o R para análisis y procesamiento de datos.
Conocimiento avanzado de SQL para la gestión y análisis de grandes bases de datos de infraestructura.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos como Power BI, Tableau o equivalentes.
Conocimientos en modelos predictivos y algoritmos de machine learning aplicados a la optimización de infraestructuras.
Familiaridad con herramientas de monitoreo y análisis de infraestructuras tecnológicas (valorable experiencia con Nagios, Zabbix, Grafana, etc.).
Experiencia trabajando en entornos de almacenamiento, backup y en servidores virtualizados.
Conocimiento en metodologías ETL para la transformación y limpieza de datos de infraestructura.







Te ofrecemos un camino lleno de aventuras:




🔹 ¡Llega hasta donde tú quieras! Crece con nuestros programas de desarrollo! Te ayudaremos a marcar tu itinerario de futuro anualmente participando en proyectos vanguardistas con los mejores profesionales del sector.

🔹 Porque lo importante sois tú y los tuyos : contamos con políticas que facilitan la conciliación entre la vida profesional y personal: Flexibilidad horaria, Smart Job y jornada intensiva en verano.

🔹 Tú decides cómo usar tu dinero: disfruta de nuestra retribución flexible, contamos con: Seguro médico, Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte.

🔹 Plan Bienestar descuentos en viajes, tecnología, formación, deporte, belleza y ¡muchos más.

🔹 Diviértete participando en los diferentes concursos y actividades que organizamos: ¿te gusta el deporte, escribir, la fotografía? Todo tiene cabida.

🔹¡Actualízate! apostamos por un aprendizaje continuo, contamos con formación especializada, certificaciones e idiomas.

🔹¡Deja tu huella! Impacta con nuestros proyectos de voluntariado social.

¡Únete a la multinacional española tecnológica referente en el mundo! 💫🌎




Atendiendo a la Ley Orgánica 3/2007, de 22 de marzo, Ayesa se ha marcado como objetivo promover la defensa y aplicación efectiva del principio de igualdad entre hombres y mujeres, evitando cualquier tipo de discriminación laboral por razón de sexo, garantizando así las mismas oportunidades de ingreso.

Description:
¡Analista de Datos – Desarrollo de BI!




En AMV SEGUROS estamos buscando talento para unirse a nuestro equipo de Business Intelligence. ¿Te sumas a la familia de los que #pensamosconelcasco?




Estamos en búsqueda de un perfil de Análisis de Datos – Desarrollo de BI con experiencia en herramientas de análisis de datos y diseño de modelos de datos. Nos gustaría encontrar a una persona con sólidos conocimientos en tecnologías como SAS y SQL, capaz de diseñar, desarrollar y optimizar soluciones de inteligencia de negocios que apoyen la toma de decisiones estratégicas de la empresa. Será un plus si tienes experiencia en Power BI, DAX y Python.




Principales funciones a desarrollar en el puesto:

Desarrollar procesos ETL usando SAS y SQL para integrar datos y generar reportes precisos y detallados.
Colaborar en el diseño y desarrollo de modelos de datos robustos, garantizando la escalabilidad y el rendimiento eficiente de las consultas.
Interpretar resultados analíticos y comunicar insights a equipos técnicos y no técnicos.
Mantener y mejorar continuamente los modelos de datos existentes.
Realizar validaciones de calidad de datos y optimizar consultas SQL para mejorar la eficiencia de los procesos.




Requisitos específicos para el puesto:

Experiencia de 4-5 años en proyectos de integración de datos y ETL.
Dominio avanzado de SAS para el manejo y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos (SAS Macros, Tablas hash).
Experiencia en SQL para la consulta, extracción y transformación de datos.
Experiencia en diseño y desarrollo de modelos de datos que soporten aplicaciones BI.
Experiencia en roles relacionados con análisis de datos o inteligencia de negocios.
Capacidad para trabajar de manera colaborativa y adaptable a entornos cambiantes.




Pluses deseables para el perfil:

Experiencia desarrollando y manteniendo reportes y dashboards interactivos utilizando Power BI y DAX, para proporcionar insights relevantes para los diferentes equipos.
Conocimientos de Python para la automatización de procesos y análisis avanzado de datos.




En AMV valoramos la actitud antes que la aptitud, por lo que si crees que puedes encajar en nuestra organización no te desalientes por no cumplir con todos los requisitos planteados.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Incorporación a un equipo dinámico dentro del departamento de Business Intelligence.
Gran equipo humano y ambiente de trabajo.
Contrato indefinido a jornada completa.
Modalidad de trabajo híbrida: combinación de teletrabajo y trabajo presencial.
27 días laborables de vacaciones anuales.
Horario de lunes a jueves de 8:00 a 17:00 horas y viernes de 8:00 a 15:00 horas.
Dispondrás de una hora de pausa para comer. Por cada día que trabajes en la oficina, recibirás un ticket restaurant. Contamos con un amplio comedor por si prefieres traer tu propia comida los días de trabajo presencial y guardar el importe de los tickets restaurant (el importe de los ticket puede ser acumulado y no caduca).
Jornada intensiva los meses de verano (julio y agosto) de lunes a viernes de 8:00 a 15:00 horas.
Póliza de seguro por riesgos de muerte, invalidez o incapacidad permanente.
Y además, cuando cumplas un año con nosotros, tendrás seguro médico a cargo de la empresa.







En AMV Seguros, creemos en el talento y en las personas que lo impulsan. Si buscas un entorno donde puedas desarrollar tus habilidades, contribuir con tus ideas y disfrutar de un excelente ambiente laboral, esta es tu oportunidad.




¡Vente con nosotros a darle al casco!

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
You are a business or engineering student looking for a stimulating work environment? You are driven by the desire to learn and work in international, diversified teams? You are looking for an experience that will be a real springboard for your professional life and personal development?




Join our BCG teams in Paris for an internship!




Who we are:




Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact. To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
SOFRILOG est un Groupe familial, numéro 2 du marché de la logistique grand froid qui se développe sur le marché du transport multi températures. Véritable challenger, nous sommes une alternative agile et désormais incontournable aux modèles historiques du marché. Notre histoire en témoigne : nous nous sommes toujours construits autour du besoin de nos client en leur apportant des solutions de logistique froid adaptées, collaboratives et responsables.

Rejoindre SOFRILOG, c’est l’assurance de contribuer à l’aventure stimulante d’une entreprise en croissance.

Dans le cadre de sa stratégie de croissance, SOFRILOG crée le poste de Data Analyst, à Caen (14)

Descriptif du poste

Doté de solides compétences en analyse de données, d'une expertise en intelligence artificielle et apprentissage automatique, vous rejoindrez la direction de la Performance et de l’Innovation dont la mission est d’appuyer l’ensemble des métiers de l’entreprise afin optimiser leurs actions en tirant le meilleur parti des données qui sont à leur disposition.

Au plus près des besoins des métiers et en étroite collaboration avec les contrôleurs de gestion, les chefs de projet IT, Logistique, Transport, IA, vous contribuerez activement à la structuration de l’entreprise et serez force de proposition pour identifier les sujets sur lesquels l’exploitation de la data est susceptible de lever des gains de productivité.

Vous éclairez les décisions de l’entreprise, par vos analyses quantitatives.

Vos Missions


Réaliser des analyses statistiques et exploratoires
Construire des dashboards de suivi des performances permettant la prise de décision efficace pour le business
Développer et déployer des modèles prédictifs et des algorythmes de machine learning pour l'optimisation de processus logistiques, de la consommation et des coûts énergétiques.
Participer à la définition, à la mise en place et à l’analyse des tests menés sur votre domaine d’intervention
Mener des études approfondies afin de mieux connaître nos clients, notre offre par métier et en proposer des modèles.


En rejoignant la direction de la Performance et de l’Innovation de SOFRILOG, vous interviendrez sur toute la variété des métiers proposés par une ETI en plein essor, spécialisée en logistique et en transport des produits surgelés. Vous contribuerez ainsi à sa structuration, à son agilité et à son développement.

Profil recherché

De formation supérieure en école d’ingénieur ou de commerce, vous avez déjà une première expérience a minima de 3 ans dans le domaine de la data analyse, idéalement acquise dans le secteur de la logistique, du transport, de la distribution ou du e-commerce.

Vous avez des compétences avancées en statistiques, maîtrisez les bases de données de type SQL et les langages de programmation. Vous avez des connaissances de techniques de machine learning.

D’un naturel curieux et dynamique, vous vous épanouissez dans les sujets complexes et analytiques. Vous avez un goût certain pour les sujets techniques et les problèmes complexes et vous savez les partager de manière claire et pédagogique.

Grâce à vos qualités relationnelles, le travail en équipe vous est naturel. Votre capacité d’adaptation et votre réactivité vous permettent d’évoluer dans un environnement en constant changement.

Capacité d'adaptation

Title: Data Analyst F/H
Description:
Description de poste

Big Data, Data Science, Data analyse, Data architecture ... Ça n’a pas de secret pour vous ?

Que vous commenciez votre carrière professionnelle ou que vous soyez spécialiste de l’une de ces disciplines, intégrer notre communauté Data, c’est l’assurance de progresser, innover, partager, vous certifier et rendre service à nos clients.

Si vous souhaitez intégrer nos équipes à Niort et accompagner les plus grands acteurs du secteur des Assurances, cette annonce est susceptible de vous intéresser.

En tant que Data Analyst dans le secteur assurantiel, votre rôle principal sera d'analyser et d'interpréter des données pour fournir des informations stratégiques et opérationnelles permettant d'améliorer la prise de décision et la performance de l'entreprise.

Fonctions et responsabilités

Vos responsabilités seront les suivantes:

Collecter et Préparer les données provenant de diverses sources internes et externes.
Assurer la qualité et la fiabilité des données en nettoyant et en transformant les données brutes.
Analyser les données
Créer des Tableaux de Bord et Rapports
Effectuer des modélisation Prédictive
Analyser les Performances
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes actuarielles
Surveiller des Tendances du Marché
Veiller à ce que toutes les activités d'analyse de données soient conformes aux normes de sécurité des données et aux réglementations en vigueur, telles que le RGPD.

En rejoignant CGI, vous bénéficiez notamment d’une offre complète de formations (techniques, métiers, développement personnel,…), de flexibilité grâce à notre accord télétravail (jusqu’à 3 jours de télétravail par semaine), d’une politique de congés avantageuse (27 jours de congés payés, RTT, congés ancienneté et enfant malade,…) et d’un package d’avantages intéressant (régime d’achats d’actions, participation, CSE,...).

Qualités requises pour réussir dans ce rôle

Flexibility in approach and innovative thinker

Our people mean the world to us, and we only recruit the best. For the talents in our business, we offer great benefits and opportunities to develop with us.


Competitive package
Private health insurance plan
Training and advancement opportunities

Title: Insight Analyst
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

The role will be data-driven and analytical support for global and local clients from FMCG and Tech & Durables industries. An Insight Analyst will be in support of one or several clients, working with internal stakeholders from client-facing NIQ teams, operating as part of a broader international community, working towards a common goal of supporting the clients in achieving their strategic business objectives thanks to insights & recommendations that are critical to our clients' success.

Responsibilities

Supporting internal NIQ stakeholders (Consultants, Account Development, local Insights Teams etc.) in their day-to-day work with the client by:


Building a strong partnership with your internal clients to make an impact delivering best in class projects, managing expectations and priorities following the aligned ways of working
Focusing on stakeholder satisfaction and cultivating productive, long-term connections
Fostering a strong understanding of your clients’ business priorities  
Executing projects by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data and consumer data, writing client reports, and building presentations.
Summarizing data in tables, charts, and graphs, reviewing data for errors and inconsistencies.
Drafting reports and presentations with simple data interpretation (category overview as well as issue-based).
Sharing and actively searching for best practice examples and implementing the approach in their own work whenever possible.
Supporting other team members during client meetings and presentations
Contributing to the team mission by participation in strategic internal projects (coaching, championship, analytical or soft-skills projects) 


Qualifications

A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU

For this business crucial role, you will have to possess strong relationship-building and stakeholder management skills. You will make a difference by helping some of the largest FMCG or T&D clients make the right choices for their growth strategies. You will partner with your colleagues to support the clients in discovering what is happening with their brands and what they should do to improve business performance.  You like working with numbers and finding ways to make your work smarter and more efficient. Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you. You want to understand how your work impacts your team and your clients, you are curious, engaged, and accountable.

Qualifications


University degree in Marketing, Business, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or related field
Total 1-3 years of experience in the FMCG, Retail, or T&D industry and/or related sales, category management, market research, data analytics
Knowledge of NielsenIQ and/or GfK data and systems would be considered as an advantage
An aptitude & desire to build trust and relationships with internal stakeholders, while being open to a client-facing role in future
Strong numerical confidence, data visualization skills, and ability to translate numbers into clear insights and recommendations 
Very good knowledge of Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, conditional functions, conditional formatting, chart building, and formatting), PowerPoint
Fluent communication in English - verbal and written (at least C1 level)
Knowledge of French, German, or Italian is an asset
Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time  
Strong interpersonal skills in a multicultural setting
Ability to work both independently and as a team player
Comfortable working in a virtual environment
Interest in the FMCG and/or T&D industry


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

The role will be data-driven and analytical support for global and local clients from FMCG and Tech & Durables industries. An Insight Analyst will be in support of one or several clients, working with internal stakeholders from client-facing NIQ teams, operating as part of a broader international community, working towards a common goal of supporting the clients in achieving their strategic business objectives thanks to insights & recommendations that are critical to our clients' success.

Responsibilities

Supporting internal NIQ stakeholders (Consultants, Account Development, local Insights Teams etc.) in their day-to-day work with the client by:

  • Building a strong partnership with your internal clients to make an impact delivering best in class projects, managing expectations and priorities following the aligned ways of working
  • Focusing on stakeholder satisfaction and cultivating productive, long-term connections
  • Fostering a strong understanding of your clients’ business priorities  
  • Executing projects by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data and consumer data, writing client reports, and building presentations.
  • Summarizing data in tables, charts, and graphs, reviewing data for errors and inconsistencies.
  • Drafting reports and presentations with simple data interpretation (category overview as well as issue-based).
  • Sharing and actively searching for best practice examples and implementing the approach in their own work whenever possible.
  • Supporting other team members during client meetings and presentations
  • Contributing to the team mission by participation in strategic internal projects (coaching, championship, analytical or soft-skills projects) 

Qualifications

A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU

For this business crucial role, you will have to possess strong relationship-building and stakeholder management skills. You will make a difference by helping some of the largest FMCG or T&D clients make the right choices for their growth strategies. You will partner with your colleagues to support the clients in discovering what is happening with their brands and what they should do to improve business performance.  You like working with numbers and finding ways to make your work smarter and more efficient. Title: Data Analyst - Growth
Description:
Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.




Team

The Engineering & Data team builds innovative tech products and platforms to support the impressive growth of their gaming and consumer apps which allow Voodoo to stay at the forefront of the mobile industry. The Engineering & Data team plays a key role in Voodoo’s long-term strategy. It enables Voodoo to both accelerate product diversification and provide a state of the art growth-engine to distribute and scale our games. They create innovative solutions that drive growth with a pragmatic approach, ranging from simple searching to complex machine learning systems.

Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst who is deeply passionate about data-driven decisions, transforming raw data into clear actionable business insights, and who is constantly driving themselves and the team towards completing the next challenge.

By joining this team, you will have a strong impact on the business and a unique opportunity to reach hundreds of millions of users with your insights and recommendations.




Develop dashboards and reports to foster company-wide comprehension of key business metrics and growth performance
Build and manage robust data pipelines to align with ever-evolving business needs, ensuring optimal architecture support
Analyze large, complex data sets representing the behaviour of millions of online and mobile game players to address strategic and operational business questions
Manage multiple projects at a time in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment
Be in direct contact with the business stakeholders and help our Growth Team better understand the data in order to optimise our User Acquisition and Monetization processes




Profile
You possess substantial experience in analytical roles
You are skilled in at least on of these skills: SQL, Python or Excel
You have practical experience with Tableau or a visualisation tool, and can create dashboards that are shared company-wide, facilitating data-driven decision-making across departments
You enjoy being in contact with stakeholders and help them achieve their business goals
A Master's degree in a top engineering or business school, in statistics, Math, Engineering, Economy, or other quantitative fields is mandatory for this role
Advanced knowledge of statistical tools and models will be considered a significant advantage




Benefits
Competitive salary upon experience
Swile Lunch voucher
Gymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)
Premium healthcare coverage SideCare, for your family is 100% borne by Voodoo
Child day care facilities (Les Petits Chaperons rouges)
Wellness activities in our Paris office
Unlimited vacation policy
Remote days
Voodoo just won the award for Best Office Space in France

Devenir une de nos pépites (on est des collectionneurs, 3000 pépites ne nous suffisent pas, on vous veut aussi). Intégrer un grand groupe détenant 70 sites en France mais qui a conservé ses valeurs familiales et sa convivialité agenaise. Vous n'êtes pas convaincu ? Et si on décrivait en quelques mots votre futur team -> Nous avons d'abord nos 2 data analyst, Estelle : discrète, sérieuse et appliquée. Experte accomplie, elle apporte une touche de rigueur aux projets. Lydéric: sociable & à l'écoute. Passionné de Beatbox et de musique, c'est aussi un grand voyageur! Ensuite, nous avons nos 2 data scientist, Mostafa , provenant tout droit du Liban il est passionné de jeux vidéo et de football. Vous êtes fan de Manchester United ? Alors ne doutez plus, ça va matcher. Balthazar, ex-manager dans l'armée et entrepreneur IT, l'attentisme n'est pas sa meilleure qualité. Passionné par la stratégie, le business, les algos, le dev et le Big Data ? Vous ferez la paire pour adresser des problématiques complexes, sans prise de tête. L'équipe data science est unique grâce à la diversité des profils qui la composent. Donc peu importe que vous soyez extravagant(e) ou introverti(e), il y aura toujours une place pour vous, chez nous ! Quant à Arthur , le responsable data, il est sociable et fan de sport. Il est très engagé, aime son métier et l'exerce avec passion et rigueur. Son bras droit, c'est Anis . Issu du monde de la recherche académique, il forme un duo complémentaire avec Arthur, où rigueur et efficacité sont les maîtres mots. Et oui, vous ne rêvez pas ! Une équipe plus sympa, vous ne trouverez pas. Description du poste Dans le cadre de notre développement, nous recherchons pour notre siège social situé à Agen (47), un/e Data Analyst en CDI. Rattaché au Responsable Data Science, votre objectif sera d'analyser et d'interpréter des données pour organiser, synthétiser et traduire efficacement des données Métiers. Intégrez l'équipe DSI d'une cinquantaine de personnes pluridisciplinaires et participez également à la transition digitale. Le but étant d'exploiter la puissance du numérique, stimuler l'innovation et améliorer le quotidien de nos équipes. Pour ce faire, vous serez chargé de : Collecter et préparer les données en veillant à leur qualité et à leur intégrité. Participer à la construction et à la maintenance des modèles de données pour garantir des indicateurs pertinents. Participer à la conception d'automatisation des processus métiers. Créer des tableaux de bord, des rapports et des visualisations pour communiquer les résultats des analyses de manière claire et concise. Effectuer des analyses exploratoires pour identifier les tendances, les modèles et les insights cachés dans les données. Apporter un appui analytique à la conduite d'exploration et à l'analyse complexe de données. Participer à l'amélioration continue des processus en proposant des méthodes, des outils et des techniques innovants. Vous l'aurez compris, votre mission sera de participer activement à la culture DATA DRIVEN du Groupe. Mais ce n'est pas tout ! Votre future poste détient une double casquette : Celle de d'accompagnateur. Vous devrez former aux outils, vulgariser des problématiques, conduire des projets (planning, présentation de résultats et de l'avancement), participer à des groupes de travail. Vous contribuerez à la conduite du changement ainsi qu'à la capitalisation des connaissances. Statut du poste : Cadre. Profil recherché Diplômé(e) d'une école d'ingénieur (ou équivalent bac +5) avec une composante mathématique et/ou informatique, vous justifiez d' une première expérience d'au moins 2 ans dans une fonction équivalente. Vous avez déjà travaillé sur un outil de BI (Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, MyReport ou autres). Vous détenez des connaissances en gestion de projets (méthodes agiles ou équivalentes), une maîtrise avancée du SQL, et un fort intérêt pour le code (Python recommandé). Une capacité à expliquer de manière claire et concise des résultats complexes sera également nécessaire. Enfin, un excellent relationnel permettant de collaborer de manière pertinente avec des profils aussi bien techniques que métier est souhaité. Le Groupe priorise le relationnel et la proximité avec ces collaborateurs. L'organisation de votre temps de travail sera à établir avec votre responsable, Arthur. Le télétravail pourra être proposé occasionnellement après validation de la période d'essai. Vous bénéficierez de la Mutuelle d'entreprise, de l'intéressement et participation, une prime d'objectif et tickets restaurants. Réf: d222fd9e-44c4-4cd5-8bf3-b5490259ce14

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
exida E&D fa parte del gruppo exida, leader internazionale nella consulenza in ambito Functional Safety e Cybersecurity. Le nostre sedi sono a Rovereto (TN) e ad Ivrea (TO). Offriamo ai nostri clienti servizi e prodotti a supporto dell’R&D (requisiti, specifiche, design, implementazione - sistema, hardware, software - e testing).

Per saperne di più, visita la nostra pagina: https://www.exida-eu.com/company/where-we-are/exida-italy sul sito www.exida-eu.com




Posizione e requisiti

Come Junior Data Analyst nel nostro team, il candidato avrà il compito di elaborare, analizzare e visualizzare i dati relativi al funzionamento e alle prestazioni di una flotta di veicoli prototipo equipaggiati con il sistema di guida autonoma di prossima generazione. La sua analisi contribuirà allo sviluppo di nuove funzionalità di aiuto alla guida e guida autonoma per alcuni dei principali marchi automobilistici europei.




Compiti:

Utilizzo di strumenti di analisi dati e software di programmazione come Spark, Pandas e Python per analizzare grandi volumi di dati.
Creazione di report e dashboard interattive per comunicare i risultati delle analisi ai team non tecnici.
Collaborazione con altri analisti e stakeholder per raffinare i processi di raccolta dati e migliorare la qualità dell'analisi.
Partecipazione attiva a meeting e presentazioni per discutere i risultati e raccomandare miglioramenti basati sui dati.




Requisiti:

Conoscenza di base dei linguaggi di programmazione come SQL e Python.
Forte interesse per il settore automotive e capacità di apprendere rapidamente concetti tecnici relativi ai veicoli.
Abilità nell'uso di strumenti come git, linux e AWS.
Capacità di lavorare con set di dati complessi e di gestire più progetti contemporaneamente.
Proattività, spirito di iniziativa e forte motivazione a sviluppare competenze analitiche.
Eccellente capacità di comunicazione e di lavoro in team, con la propensione a condividere conoscenze e risultati.




Altre informazioni

Per ogni nuovo dipendente è prevista la formazione di base sulle principali normative di riferimento del settore automotive: A-SPICE, ISO26262, ISO/IEC21434, TISAX/VDA, AUTOSAR. Altre competenze necessarie per il ruolo verranno acquisite attraverso l’attività lavorativa o corsi mirati (interni o erogati da terze parti).




Per la parte contrattuale si assicura massima serietà e trasparenza.

Title: Analytics & Insights Analyst
Description:
# 163253 - Piraeus, Attiki, Greece

Who We Are

Colgate-Palmolive Company is a caring, innovative growth company that is reimagining a healthier future for all people, their pets and our planet. Focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition, we sell our products in more than 200 countries and territories under brands such as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, hello, meridol, Sorriso, Tom’s of Maine, EltaMD, Filorga, Irish Spring, PCA SKIN, Protex, Sanex, Softsoap, Speed Stick, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Pet Nutrition.

We are recognised for our leadership and innovation in promoting sustainability and community wellbeing, including our achievements in decreasing plastic waste and promoting recyclability, saving water, conserving natural resources and improving children’s oral health.

If you want to work for a company that lives by their values, then give your career a reason to smile and join our global team!

Join our Customer Development team as an Analytics & Insights Analyst (1-Year contract via Outsource Provider) and be part of a mission for a healthier future for people and the planet.

Role Overview:

In this 1-year contract role, you will translate data into powerful insights that enhance our sales strategies and deepen customer relationships. Your analytical skills will help drive category growth and optimize performance, supporting our mission to deliver products that make a positive impact.

Key Responsibilities:


Data-Driven Insights: Analyze sales data, customer trends, and market movements to unlock growth opportunities.
Sales Performance: Track and monitor key metrics to pinpoint risks, spot trends, and highlight opportunities.
Customer-Centric Solutions: Dive deep into customer behavior to craft insights that shape targeted strategies and fuel engagement.
Category Support: Guide category decisions with data-backed insights on product assortments, pricing, and promotions.
Real-Time Dashboards: Build interactive dashboards for dynamic, on-the-go decision-making.
Predictive Analytics: Forecast future trends and customer needs using advanced models.
Insight Presentation: Present clear, concise findings that influence strategic decisions.


Qualifications:


Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Science, or related field.
Experience: 1-2 years in an analytics role within FMCG or consumer industries preferred.
Tech-Savvy: Proficiency in Excel. Knowledge of SQL, Python, or R is a plus.
Data Interpreter: Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.


Location: Athens office

VISA NOT SPONSORED

Our Commitment to Sustainability

With the Colgate brand in more homes than any other, we are presented with great opportunities and new challenges as we work to integrate sustainability into all aspects of our business and create positive social impact. We are determined to position ourselves for further growth as we act on our 2025 Sustainability & Social Impact Strategy.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Achieving our purpose starts with our people — ensuring our workforce represents the people and communities we serve —and creating an environment where our people feel they belong; where we can be our authentic selves, feel treated with respect and have the support of leadership to impact the business in a meaningful way.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.

Reasonable accommodation during the application process is available for persons with disabilities. Please contact Application_Accommodation@colpal.com with the subject "Accommodation Request" should you require accommodation.

Title: Data Analyst - Intern (Remote Internship - Data Analysis)

Delve into the dynamic world of data analysis with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and unlock your career aspirations in data analysis!

If you're passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Gain hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your home.

Internship Overview and Details:

Location: Fully Remote

Schedule: Part-Time Internship

Duration: 3 months with the possibility of permanent employment after the internship period

Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Aspiring data analysts keen on unraveling complex datasets and extracting meaningful insights.
Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations.
Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings.
Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, analytical environments.
Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) highly valued.
Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualization, and database management advantageous.
Some initial industry experience is a big plus.


Your Contribution:


Contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis processes.
Collaborate with the data analysis team to develop analytical models and insights.
Aid in interpreting data trends and patterns to inform strategic decision-making.
Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to tackle data challenges.
Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in data analysis.
Assist in documenting and presenting analysis results and recommendations.


Benefits

Why Join Us?

Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in data analysis today!

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!

Description:
We’re a team of 500+ professionals who develop cutting-edge proxy and web data scraping solutions for thousands of the world’s best known businesses, including Fortune 500 companies. What’s in store for you: You’ll be developing complex products with high coding standards, maintaining our own infrastructure, handling petabytes of data, and solving challenges on a daily basis. We got you covered with a team of strong professionals to support you, a well-built tech stack, and loads of ownership. A word from the team: Here at Oxylabs, ambition is contagious. Our goal is to enable you to drive your own development. We have the freedom to create, explore and innovate. When energy and sincerity have a place to prosper, it helps create a solid team, consisting of diverse talents, competencies, and skills. This time, we need you on our team! As our new Data Analyst you will be responsible for addressing a diverse and challenging range of problems to help us make better business decisions at Oxylabs.io. You will work with multiple teams internally (marketing, commercial, product, sales, account management) in order to support their growth, to provide business trend analysis and actionable insights, to define key metrics and help them identify revenue opportunities. This role is a great opportunity for an Analyst who thrives in a fast-paced environment, is looking for a high degree of ownership and is willing to learn new technologies. Your day-to-day:


Develop a foundational understanding of the relationships between customer behavior and our growth drivers through data analysis and data modelling
Assist in creating and maintaining self-service dashboards for stakeholders across the business, using PowerBI or Superset
Utilize analytical tools (SQL, Python, Google Sheets) to prepare and analyze data, supporting key decision-making processes
Support senior analysts in identifying new research areas and providing recommendations to business stakeholders
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to address stakeholder questions, focusing on commercial impact and effectively communicating your findings



Your skills & experience:


1+ years of experience in an analytical role or relevant internship, preferably working with business leaders or strategy stakeholders
Ability to generate actionable insights from data analysis, with a growing understanding of how these insights can drive business impact
Knowledge of Excel/Google Sheets where some of your exploratory analysis will take place
Familiarity with creating dashboards using PowerBI, Superset, Tableau, Looker, or other data visualization tools
Some experience or training in data manipulation and analysis using SQL or Python
You’re a problem solver at heart and a team player
You’re pragmatic and impact-focused: you will choose Excel over Python if it is a better solution for the problem and vice-versa
You’re commercially aware and user-focused – able to understand needs and identify priorities to unlock business value through analytics
You have a technical aptitude and don’t shy away from engineering-related discussions
You’re excellent at communicating in both written and spoken English



Tech stack:


Google Cloud Platform (GCS, BQ) for storage and warehousing
dbt and SQL for data modelling
Python for automation
Jupyter for ad-hoc analysis
PowerBI and Superset for data visualisation
Airflow for orchestration



Salary:


Gross salary: 1990 - 2980 EUR/month. Keep in mind that we are open to discuss a different salary based on your skills and competencies

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

The Hashgraph Association (THA) is a global organization headquartered in Switzerland, and is a part of the Hedera Hashgraph (“Hedera”) ecosystem.




Hedera is a revolutionary proof-of-stake public Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT) network that is fast emerging as the gold standard in DLT for enterprise-grade solutions and decentralized applications (dApps). Hedera is governed by a council of the world’s leading organizations - which include Google, Boeing, IBM, Dell, Deutsche Telekom, LG, Abrdn, London School of Economics, to name a few.




THA works closely with enterprises, startups, governments, and academic and training institutions around the world to deliver financing, custom-design solutions, and professional training and innovation programs, aimed at accelerating the development and utilization of the Hedera Hashgraph network.




As we undergo rapid expansion, we are establishing offices in strategic locations worldwide. We are currently seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for leveraging Clickup (Project Management Platforms) to maintain, build, and extract data, as well as possessing proficiency in Power BI and dashboarding. This role offers the opportunity to work with diverse datasets, contribute to strategic decision-making processes, and drive business insights.







Responsibilities:

Data Management:

Utilize Clickup for maintaining, building, and extracting data to support organizational needs.
Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and reliability for effective analysis.




Analytics and Reporting:

Develop and implement data-driven solutions using Power BI for creating insightful and visually appealing dashboards.
Generate regular reports and ad-hoc analyses to support business operations and decision-making.




Data Extraction and Transformation:

Extract relevant data from various sources and transform it into a format suitable for analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.




Quality Assurance:

Conduct thorough quality checks on datasets to identify and rectify discrepancies.
Implement best practices for data integrity and contribute to continuous improvement efforts.




Collaboration:

Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.
Collaborate with IT teams to ensure seamless integration of data sources and maintain data integrity.




Your profile

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Statistics, or Computer Science.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst with expertise in using Clickup and other project management platforms.
Proficient in Power BI and other dashboarding tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.

Preferred Skills:

Familiarity with data visualization techniques and best practices.
Experience in extracting and transforming data from diverse sources.
Knowledge of SQL, Python, or other relevant programming languages is a plus.
Prior experience in a similar role within Web3/Blockchain is advantageous.




Why us?

A unique opportunity to be a part of the world’s leading DLT ecosystem
Significant career growth potential in a fast growing sector
Working with colleagues and on projects across the globe
Open and direct communication, flat structures
Flexible working hours
Competitive salary package

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
SOFRILOG est un Groupe familial, numéro 2 du marché de la logistique grand froid qui se développe sur le marché du transport multi températures. Véritable challenger, nous sommes une alternative agile et désormais incontournable aux modèles historiques du marché. Notre histoire en témoigne : nous nous sommes toujours construits autour du besoin de nos client en leur apportant des solutions de logistique froid adaptées, collaboratives et responsables.

Rejoindre SOFRILOG, c’est l’assurance de contribuer à l’aventure stimulante d’une entreprise en croissance.

Dans le cadre de sa stratégie de croissance, SOFRILOG crée le poste de Data Analyst, à Caen (14)

Descriptif du poste

Doté de solides compétences en analyse de données, d'une expertise en intelligence artificielle et apprentissage automatique, vous rejoindrez la direction de la Performance et de l’Innovation dont la mission est d’appuyer l’ensemble des métiers de l’entreprise afin optimiser leurs actions en tirant le meilleur parti des données qui sont à leur disposition.

Au plus près des besoins des métiers et en étroite collaboration avec les contrôleurs de gestion, les chefs de projet IT, Logistique, Transport, IA, vous contribuerez activement à la structuration de l’entreprise et serez force de proposition pour identifier les sujets sur lesquels l’exploitation de la data est susceptible de lever des gains de productivité.

Vous éclairez les décisions de l’entreprise, par vos analyses quantitatives.

Vos Missions


Réaliser des analyses statistiques et exploratoires
Construire des dashboards de suivi des performances permettant la prise de décision efficace pour le business
Développer et déployer des modèles prédictifs et des algorythmes de machine learning pour l'optimisation de processus logistiques, de la consommation et des coûts énergétiques.
Participer à la définition, à la mise en place et à l’analyse des tests menés sur votre domaine d’intervention
Mener des études approfondies afin de mieux connaître nos clients, notre offre par métier et en proposer des modèles.


En rejoignant la direction de la Performance et de l’Innovation de SOFRILOG, vous interviendrez sur toute la variété des métiers proposés par une ETI en plein essor, spécialisée en logistique et en transport des produits surgelés. Vous contribuerez ainsi à sa structuration, à son agilité et à son développement.

Profil recherché

De formation supérieure en école d’ingénieur ou de commerce, vous avez déjà une première expérience a minima de 3 ans dans le domaine de la data analyse, idéalement acquise dans le secteur de la logistique, du transport, de la distribution ou du e-commerce.

Vous avez des compétences avancées en statistiques, maîtrisez les bases de données de type SQL et les langages de programmation. Vous avez des connaissances de techniques de machine learning.

D’un naturel curieux et dynamique, vous vous épanouissez dans les sujets complexes et analytiques. Vous avez un goût certain pour les sujets techniques et les problèmes complexes et vous savez les partager de manière claire et pédagogique.

Grâce à vos qualités relationnelles, le travail en équipe vous est naturel. Votre capacité d’adaptation et votre réactivité vous permettent d’évoluer dans un environnement en constant changement.

Title: Data Analyst F/H
Description:
Description de poste

Big Data, Data Science, Data analyse, Data architecture ... Ça n’a pas de secret pour vous ?

Que vous commenciez votre carrière professionnelle ou que vous soyez spécialiste de l’une de ces disciplines, intégrer notre communauté Data, c’est l’assurance de progresser, innover, partager, vous certifier et rendre service à nos clients.

Si vous souhaitez intégrer nos équipes à Niort et accompagner les plus grands acteurs du secteur des Assurances, cette annonce est susceptible de vous intéresser.

En tant que Data Analyst dans le secteur assurantiel, votre rôle principal sera d'analyser et d'interpréter des données pour fournir des informations stratégiques et opérationnelles permettant d'améliorer la prise de décision et la performance de l'entreprise.

Fonctions et responsabilités

Vos responsabilités seront les suivantes:

Collecter et Préparer les données provenant de diverses sources internes et externes.
Assurer la qualité et la fiabilité des données en nettoyant et en transformant les données brutes.
Analyser les données
Créer des Tableaux de Bord et Rapports
Effectuer des modélisation Prédictive
Analyser les Performances
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes actuarielles
Surveiller des Tendances du Marché
Veiller à ce que toutes les activités d'analyse de données soient conformes aux normes de sécurité des données et aux réglementations en vigueur, telles que le RGPD.

En rejoignant CGI, vous bénéficiez notamment d’une offre complète de formations (techniques, métiers, développement personnel,…), de flexibilité grâce à notre accord télétravail (jusqu’à 3 jours de télétravail par semaine), d’une politique de congés avantageuse (27 jours de congés payés, RTT, congés ancienneté et enfant malade,…) et d’un package d’avantages intéressant (régime d’achats d’actions, participation, CSE,...).

Qualités requises pour réussir dans ce rôle

Ayant une première expérience en Data, vous maitrisez les technologies suivantes:

Les langages de programmation et de requêtage tels que Python, R, SAS et SQL.
Solides compétences en analyse statistique et en modélisation de données, en particulier dans un environnement SAS.
Expérience avec des outils de Business Intelligence tels que Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, etc.

Connaissance approfondie des techniques d'apprentissage automatique et de l'analyse.

CGI est un employeur inclusif et attentif aux candidatures des personnes en situation de handicap, à l’évolution de carrières des hommes et des femmes et au bien-être de nos salariés LGBT+. Dans un souci d’accessibilité et de clarté, le point médian n’est pas utilisé dans cette annonce. Tous les termes employés se réfèrent aussi bien au genre féminin que masculin.

Ensemble, en tant que propriétaires, mettons notre savoir-faire à l’œuvre.

La vie chez CGI est ancrée dans l’actionnariat, le travail d’équipe, le respect et un sentiment d’appartenance. Chez nous, vous pourrez exploiter votre plein potentiel parce que…

Nous vous invitons à devenir propriétaire dès le jour 1 alors que nous travaillons ensemble à faire de notre rêve une réalité. C’est pourquoi nous nous désignons comme associés de CGI, plutôt que comme employés. Nous tirons profit des retombées de notre succès collectif et contribuons activement à l’orientation et à la stratégie de notre entreprise.

Votre travail crée de la valeur. Vous élaborerez des solutions novatrices et développerez des relations durables avec vos collègues et clients, tout en ayant accès à des capacités mondiales pour concrétiser vos idées, saisir de nouvelles opportunités, et bénéficier d’une expertise sectorielle et technologique de pointe.

Vous ferez évoluer votre carrière en vous joignant à une entreprise bâtie pour croître et durer. Vous serez soutenus par des leaders qui ont votre santé et bien-être à cœur et qui vous permettront de saisir des occasions afin de parfaire vos compétences et élargir les horizons.

Joignez-vous à nous, l’une des plus importantes entreprises de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.

Description:
Dedichiamo tempo e cura alla valorizzazione del tuo talento, investiamo nelle tue competenze e diamo spazio alla tua voglia di metterti alla prova e fare la differenza. Se vuoi crescere insieme a ONIT verso l'obiettivo di essere il miglior partner nell'innovazione digitale, entra a far parte del nostro team!

La certificazione Great Place to Work conferma il nostro impegno per un ambiente lavorativo in cui il benessere e lo sviluppo delle persone sono la priorità, tanto quanto la soddisfazione dei clienti.

Profilo ricercato:

Ricerchiamo una figura di Data Analyst qualificata e proattiva. La persona ideale ha 1-2 anni di esperienza e ha conseguito la Laurea in Informatica o discipline STEM.

Si occuperà di analisi dei requisiti, progettazione e realizzazione di ambienti interattivi per l'analisi dati e creazione di strati semantici per facilitare l’accesso ai dati, anche da parte di utenti non tecnici. Sarà coinvolta in studi di fattibilità, confronto di soluzioni e stima dei benefici, garantendo la copertura funzionale.

Dovrà inoltre produrre documentazione, manuali utente e formare il personale, anche con training on the job. Infine, parteciperà alla sperimentazione di nuovi prodotti, sviluppo di prototipi e valutazione delle nuove tecnologie attraverso analisi costi/benefici.




Skills tecniche




Modellazione dati di tipo normalizzato per basi dati operazionali e modelli dati per il data warehouse, metodologia e modelli OLAP e ROLAP, tecniche di analisi multidimensionale, linguaggio SQL
Conoscenza di tematiche applicative, best practice e metodologie di analisi, disegno e test in ambito data warehouse, business intelligence e analytics
Conoscenza della piattaforma Qlik Sense per l’analisi e l'elaborazione dei dati, la produzione di reportistica, la realizzazione di strati semantici per l'accesso ai dati da parte di utenti non specialisti
Conoscenza della piattaforma MS Power BI per l’analisi e l'elaborazione dei dati, la produzione di reportistica, la realizzazione di strati semantici per l'accesso ai dati da parte di utenti non specialisti.




Soft Skills




Capacità di lavorare in team e comunicare efficacemente
Capacità analitiche e problem-solving
Curiosità e propensione all’apprendimento costante
Precisione e orientamento all’obiettivo

Possibilità di smart-working

Title: Analytics & Insights Analyst
Description:
# 163253 - Piraeus, Attiki, Greece

Who We Are

Colgate-Palmolive Company is a caring, innovative growth company that is reimagining a healthier future for all people, their pets and our planet. Focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition, we sell our products in more than 200 countries and territories under brands such as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, hello, meridol, Sorriso, Tom’s of Maine, EltaMD, Filorga, Irish Spring, PCA SKIN, Protex, Sanex, Softsoap, Speed Stick, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Pet Nutrition.

We are recognised for our leadership and innovation in promoting sustainability and community wellbeing, including our achievements in decreasing plastic waste and promoting recyclability, saving water, conserving natural resources and improving children’s oral health.

If you want to work for a company that lives by their values, then give your career a reason to smile and join our global team!

Join our Customer Development team as an Analytics & Insights Analyst (1-Year contract via Outsource Provider) and be part of a mission for a healthier future for people and the planet.

Role Overview:

In this 1-year contract role, you will translate data into powerful insights that enhance our sales strategies and deepen customer relationships. Your analytical skills will help drive category growth and optimize performance, supporting our mission to deliver products that make a positive impact.

Key Responsibilities:


Data-Driven Insights: Analyze sales data, customer trends, and market movements to unlock growth opportunities.
Sales Performance: Track and monitor key metrics to pinpoint risks, spot trends, and highlight opportunities.
Customer-Centric Solutions: Dive deep into customer behavior to craft insights that shape targeted strategies and fuel engagement.
Category Support: Guide category decisions with data-backed insights on product assortments, pricing, and promotions.
Real-Time Dashboards: Build interactive dashboards for dynamic, on-the-go decision-making.
Predictive Analytics: Forecast future trends and customer needs using advanced models.
Insight Presentation: Present clear, concise findings that influence strategic decisions.


Qualifications:


Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Science, or related field.
Experience: 1-2 years in an analytics role within FMCG or consumer industries preferred.
Tech-Savvy: Proficiency in Excel. Knowledge of SQL, Python, or R is a plus.
Data Interpreter: Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.


Location: Athens office

VISA NOT SPONSORED

Our Commitment to Sustainability

With the Colgate brand in more homes than any other, we are presented with great opportunities and new challenges as we work to integrate sustainability into all aspects of our business and create positive social impact. Achieving our purpose starts with our people — ensuring our workforce represents the people and communities we serve —and creating an environment where our people feel they belong; where we can be our authentic selves, feel treated with respect and have the support of leadership to impact the business in a meaningful way.

If you're passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Gain hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your home.

Location: Fully Remote

Schedule: Part-Time Internship

Requirements

Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.

Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations.
Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings.

Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis.
