Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Dyninno is a group of companies providing products and services in the travel, finance, entertainment, and technology sectors in 50+ countries. The company develops and implements innovations and technology in its products. Thanks to that, casting professionals quickly find true talent, travelers get the best ticket prices for flights from over 70+ airlines in a fraction of a second, and clients have access to loan products and financial instruments in just one click from anywhere in the world.



EcoFinance is a dynamic and rapidly growing fintech company with operations across Europe and Southeast Asia. Currently, we are active in Moldova, Romania, and the Philippines, with plans for expansion into new markets. We specialize in consumer lending, offering innovative financial solutions that empower individuals and businesses alike.


We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Data Science and Analysis team in Riga. In this role, you will play a critical part in driving data-driven decisions by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex datasets. Your insights will support risk management, optimize portfolio performance, and contribute to the development of analytical solutions that shape business strategy.



Responsibilities:


  • Work with both internal and external data sources for accurate data collection, cleansing, and analysis;
  • Design and implement analytical solutions to support effective risk management strategies;
  • Prepare and interpret regular and ad hoc risk reports, providing actionable insights for management;
  • Draw conclusions from available data and offer recommendations on risk policy adjustments;
  • Collaborate in optimizing risk policies to maximize value from risk models;
  • Participate in portfolio analysis to assess risk exposure, identify trends, and monitor performance metrics across different segments. Provide data-driven recommendations to optimize portfolio performance;
  • Present analytics solutions and findings to stakeholders and help implement improvements into operational systems.


Requirements:


  • Higher education in statistics, applied mathematics, economics, or related discipline.
  • Experience with data extraction, analysis, and reporting.
  • Ability to approach problem-solving analytically with attention to detail.
  • Expert knowledge of SQL for querying large datasets and database management.
  • Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis, and process automation.
  • Open to learning new tools, techniques, and methodologies.
  • Experience with BI tools (e.g., Looker, Power BI) is an advantage.
  • Familiarity with job schedulers (e.g. Cron) is a plus.
  • Basic understanding of building and optimizing ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to support data pipelines.
  • Prior experience in the financial services industry will be considered as an advantage.


There is no one-size-fits-all here, we are quite flexible and use an individual approach with every candidate we meet. While getting familiar during our interview, we try to understand where your working experience, professional skills and future contribution to the company can be applied within our multiple business projects.


We don’t want to set any limits, but if we are naming the numbers, then the salary for this position starts from 2200 EUR gross per month depending on your experience and skills.


With us you will:


  • Be a part of a top-tier team, work on projects that reach millions worldwide, and create complex in-house products and solutions;
  • Learn and exchange ideas in lectures and workshops led by colleagues and team leads;
  • Get health benefits: fully covered health insurance after end of the trial period (dentistry, out-patient treatment, mental health, medicine, etc.), well-being activities, vaccination days;
  • Enjoy employee discount programs and have fun at monthly internal activities and celebrations;
  • Work from a modern and well-equipped office in the center of Riga, with parking space for bikes and scooters, fresh fruits and coffee on a daily basis.


Please note that the processing of your personal data takes place in accordance with the privacy notice, which could be found here - https://dyninno.com/en/privacy-policy/

Title: Junior Data Analyst | MySQL & PowerBI (1y contract | Remote)
HTML:
iubenda is a legal-tech scale-up founded in 2011, now trusted by over 110K clients in the EU, the US, and 100+ more Countries. We are leaders in our industry and operate on a global scale developing and releasing innovative tech solutions.
Our mission is to provide our clients with everything their business needs - to be compliant with legal, local, and regional requirements; so that they can focus on their core product. Recently, we have undertaken a new thrilling adventure, joining forces with team.blue (a worldwide leader in digital enablement). If you're excited to work at a company in a scaling-up environment providing SaaS solutions to ~1M users - and equally important - to join a team of friendly people with a culture based on continuous learning, transparency, and collaboration. Then, you're looking at the right place!


Your mission

We're looking for an enthusiastic Junior Data Analyst to join our Finance Team and be responsible for providing support in business KPIs optimization, and systems reconciliation. Will be in charge of:
- Collection and analyses of data coming from different systems (i.e., data warehouse, databases, and web apps);
- Drafting reports, presentations, and business analyses related also, but not only, to web analytics services through BI tools;
- Taking care of churn and retention analysis, funnel optimization, A/B testing, customer scoring, and predictive modeling;
- Interacting with different teams, especially the Software Development and Accounting ones.


Requirements

- At least 1 year of experience in a similar role;
- Sound knowledge of MySQL;
- Sound knowledge of PowerBI or Tableau (aimed at creating and managing dashboards);
- Good Excel skills (i.e., complex formulas and visual charts);
- Familiarity with general economics concepts;
- Full professional proficiency in English.


Added values

- Familiarity with statistics, predictive models, and AI tools (such as ChatGPT, Gemini, etc.);
- Sound knowledge of Python language (aimed at MySQL connections, CSV imports, connections with external sources, data processing, and data visualization);
- Good knowledge of marketing tools such as Heap.io, Funnel.io, or similar (aimed at extracting data and creating and managing dashboards);
- Proactive and willing to provide ideas and propose improvements;
- Previous experience in a SaaS company.


Location

At iubenda we believe in full-remote. Accordingly, you will be completely free and entitled to work from wherever you prefer in the world. At the same time in case you prefer to work from an office, at your disposal you have our Italian (Milan and Bologna) and German (Berlin and Hamburg) offices, to allow you to follow a hybrid work model.


Benefits

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re a team of 500+ professionals who develop cutting-edge proxy and web data scraping solutions for thousands of the world’s best known businesses, including Fortune 500 companies. What’s in store for you: You’ll be developing complex products with high coding standards, maintaining our own infrastructure, handling petabytes of data, and solving challenges on a daily basis. We got you covered with a team of strong professionals to support you, a well-built tech stack, and loads of ownership. A word from the team: Here at Oxylabs, ambition is contagious. Our goal is to enable you to drive your own development. We have the freedom to create, explore and innovate. When energy and sincerity have a place to prosper, it helps create a solid team, consisting of diverse talents, competencies, and skills. This time, we need you on our team! As our new Data Analyst you will be responsible for addressing a diverse and challenging range of problems to help us make better business decisions at Oxylabs.io. You will work with multiple teams internally (marketing, commercial, product, sales, account management) in order to support their growth, to provide business trend analysis and actionable insights, to define key metrics and help them identify revenue opportunities. This role is a great opportunity for an Analyst who thrives in a fast-paced environment, is looking for a high degree of ownership and is willing to learn new technologies. Your day-to-day:


Develop a foundational understanding of the relationships between customer behavior and our growth drivers through data analysis and data modelling
Assist in creating and maintaining self-service dashboards for stakeholders across the business, using PowerBI or Superset
Utilize analytical tools (SQL, Python, Google Sheets) to prepare and analyze data, supporting key decision-making processes
Support senior analysts in identifying new research areas and providing recommendations to business stakeholders
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to address stakeholder questions, focusing on commercial impact and effectively communicating your findings



Your skills & experience:


1+ years of experience in an analytical role or relevant internship, preferably working with business leaders or strategy stakeholders
Ability to generate actionable insights from data analysis, with a growing understanding of how these insights can drive business impact
Knowledge of Excel/Google Sheets where some of your exploratory analysis will take place
Familiarity with creating dashboards using PowerBI, Superset, Tableau, Looker, or other data visualization tools
Some experience or training in data manipulation and analysis using SQL or Python
You’re a problem solver at heart and a team player
You’re pragmatic and impact-focused: you will choose Excel over Python if it is a better solution for the problem and vice-versa
You’re commercially aware and user-focused – able to understand needs and identify priorities to unlock business value through analytics
You have a technical aptitude and don’t shy away from engineering-related discussions
You’re excellent at communicating in both written and spoken English



Tech stack:


Google Cloud Platform (GCS, BQ) for storage and warehousing
dbt and SQL for data modelling
Python for automation
Jupyter for ad-hoc analysis
PowerBI and Superset for data visualisation
Airflow for orchestration



Salary:


Gross salary: 1990 - 2980 EUR/month. Keep in mind that we are open to discuss a different salary based on your skills and competencies

The Hashgraph Association (THA) is a global organization headquartered in Switzerland, and is a part of the Hedera Hashgraph (“Hedera”) ecosystem.




Hedera is a revolutionary proof-of-stake public Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT) network that is fast emerging as the gold standard in DLT for enterprise-grade solutions and decentralized applications (dApps). Hedera is governed by a council of the world’s leading organizations - which include Google, Boeing, IBM, Dell, Deutsche Telekom, LG, Abrdn, London School of Economics, to name a few.




THA works closely with enterprises, startups, governments, and academic and training institutions around the world to deliver financing, custom-design solutions, and professional training and innovation programs, aimed at accelerating the development and utilization of the Hedera Hashgraph network.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for leveraging Clickup (Project Management Platforms) to maintain, build, and extract data, as well as possessing proficiency in Power BI and dashboarding. This role offers the opportunity to work with diverse datasets, contribute to strategic decision-making processes, and drive business insights.

Data Management:

Utilize Clickup for maintaining, building, and extracting data to support organizational needs.

Analytics and Reporting:

Develop and implement data-driven solutions using Power BI for creating insightful and visually appealing dashboards.
Generate regular reports and ad-hoc analyses to support business operations and decision-making.




Data Extraction and Transformation:

Extract relevant data from various sources and transform it into a format suitable for analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.




Quality Assurance:

Conduct thorough quality checks on datasets to identify and rectify discrepancies.
Implement best practices for data integrity and contribute to continuous improvement efforts.




Collaboration:

Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.
Collaborate with IT teams to ensure seamless integration of data sources and maintain data integrity.




Your profile

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Statistics, or Computer Science.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst with expertise in using Clickup and other project management platforms.
Proficient in Power BI and other dashboarding tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.

Preferred Skills:

Familiarity with data visualization techniques and best practices.
Experience in extracting and transforming data from diverse sources.
Knowledge of SQL, Python, or other relevant programming languages is a plus.
Prior experience in a similar role within Web3/Blockchain is advantageous.




Why us?

A unique opportunity to be a part of the world’s leading DLT ecosystem

Working with colleagues and on projects across the globe
Open and direct communication, flat structures
Flexible working hours
Competitive salary package
